descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course serves as a general introduction to the field of cognitive psychology. In the most general terms, cognitive psychology is the scientific study of mental processes, how the mind works (and fails to work). We will cover topics such as perception, attention, memory, representation of knowledge, language, reasoning and problem solving, and judgment and decision-making. Classes will consist of lectures, in-class demonstrations, and discussions. Students will be required to critically read and present relevant academic papers.
